Speaker: joshua
Dialogue: Which one are we going to?

Speaker: joshua
Dialogue: Tony said that Mickey is not really Mickey; it's someone else in there.

Speaker: joshua
Dialogue: Also, Tony said he saw a chef Mickey and a normal Mickey.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: He must have changed his clothes for work.

Speaker: tutorial
Dialogue: Pardon me. Where is the nearest restaurant? Pardonnez-moi. Ou est le restaurant le plus proche?

Speaker: tutorial
Dialogue: Can you show me the nearest bathroom? Pouvez-vous me montrer la salle de bain la plus prouche?

Speaker: andre
Dialogue: This is some shit right here.

Speaker: tutorial
Dialogue: Can you help me find a hotel? Pouvez-vous m'aider a trouver mon hotel?

Speaker: tutorial
Dialogue: Can you please call the police? Pouvez-vous s'il vous plait appelez la police?

Speaker: joshua
Dialogue: Tony said Mickey's face doesn't move.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Poor thing. Do you even pet him?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Are you kidding me? When you're not here that dog gets the best fuckin' pets of his life.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: So, how come whenever I come over, he acts like he's been totally neglected.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: `Cause he know he's got you wrapped around his little paw.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Why? They're going to love you.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Let's see, you're smart, sweet, handsome, creative... You're you.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: I don't think so. Why? Should they?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Seems like you might give them a heads up.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Really? Like "Mom, Dad, my black boyfriend is coming up for the weekend"?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: You said, I'm the first black guy you'd ever dated.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: So this is uncharted territory for them.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Baby, it's fine. My dad would legit vote for Obama a third time he could. Yes, he will want to talk to you about it, and that will be embarrassing, but they're gonna love you. I promise.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: How do they even let you in a hospital?

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Shut up. I'm very sanitary at work.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: 10 months, so a year basically; longest I've ever been away.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Whoa... whoa!! Come on! I'm a grown man. If a man says he wants a cigarette, a man should be able TOO- -

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I didn't buy them. Rod... Shit.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: Yeah. How I'm gonna get in trouble for following standard procedure? Fuckin' Gary out here thinkin' just because a bitch old, she can't hijack an airplane.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Look, man, real quick. You good to watch Sid this weekend right?

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: What? You think I forgot? Damn `C', give your boy a little credit. I don't forget shit; you do.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: Whattup babygirl? You better bring my boy back in one piece.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: I don't even know what that means but yes I promise.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: You know you picked the wrong guy though right?

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: It's not too late for us is it?

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: Damn, I never seen you like this. Meeting the family and everything? What does she do lick your ass?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: No! What the fuck is wrong with you?

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: That's it! First girl licks your ass and you done. Just...

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: Yeah I do. I need your girl to introduce me to one of her freaky deaky boarding school friends.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I'll see what I can do. Oh, and I'll kick you some cash for watching Sid.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: Come on, son! I don't need your money. I got you!

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: You better not come back all bougie on me tho--

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: What..? Settle down. You know I'm yours.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Yeah. That scared the shit out of me.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I don't know... See if it's okay?

Speaker: officer crowe
Dialogue: So in the future the number to call is Animal Control Services.

Speaker: officer crowe
Dialogue: You two coming up from the city?

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: I'm from here. The Lake Pontaco area? We're going home.

Speaker: officer crowe
Dialogue: I didn't ask who was driving. I asked him for his I.D.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: My boyfriend shouldn't have to show you his I.D. because he hasn't done anything wrong.

Speaker: officer crowe
Dialogue: Ma'am, any time there is an INCIDENT--

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: It's bullshit, and you know it.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: What? I'm not gonna let anyone fuck with my man.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: That was some ride or die shit, baby. I like that.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: That's the grounds-keeper... I think his name is Walter.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Chris, these are my parents. Mom, Dad, this is Chris.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I've heard so much about you guys.

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: Yes, you'll do just fine. So handsome.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Can we get inside before you guys start embarrassing me?

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: Of course, come inside, make yourself at home.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I'm fine with the embarrassing by the way; go ahead.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I grew up in a one bedroom, so for me, this is ridiculous.

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: It ought to be. Lord knows we've done enough work on it through the years...

Speaker: chris rose
Dialogue: Yeah. Yeah. It just fruck us out.

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: You know what I say. One down... a few hundred thousand to go.

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: Let them unload their bags first.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: You think they wish I was still a kid?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I cannot believe they kept it the same.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: I told you they'd love you.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: There's a lot you don't know about me.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: We just got here. I don't wanna be disrespectful...

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Who gives a fuck? Be disrespectful.

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: Frankenstein's monster. Only pieces of the original structure remain; I like to think the soul is in tact though.

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: He went through a couple dark spots but came out the other side. You'll meet him later.

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: Mother and Father lived here till the end. They died a few years ago now. Passed away within weeks of each other...

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I hear that happens a lot.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Not really. That one always just stood out in my mind.

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: Of course. One of those perfect moments. There's Hitler on his high horse with his perfect Aryan race, and here comes this black guy to prove him wrong on the world's stage. What a moment.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Yeah, tough break for your father though.

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: Okay Snowbell just looking.  Missy's office. This is where she takes appointments.

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: Yeah. One of the best in the world. Not a tidy woman.

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: A neurosurgeon; was. I retired early. Now, I pretty much focus on the house and twiddle my thumbs.

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: Oh, Georgina, this is Chris; Rose's boyfriend.

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: Ah ha! But now for the piece de resistance...

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: Badminton and bocce ball, croquet; we're a family who loves games. Two other families have properties on lake Pontaco, and they're way on the other side. Total privacy.

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: You didn't have to. We hired them a few years ago to help care for my parents; they became part of the family. Couldn't bear to let them go. I hate the way it makes us look though...

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: Rose tells us your parents aren't with us.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: My Dad was never really in the picture. My mom passed away when I was 11; She was hit by a car.

Speaker: missy dean
Dialogue: Oh, that's awful; so young. I'm so sorry to hear that.

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: You two seem like you've been together for years. How long has it been now?

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: `Atta boy Chris. Get used to saying that.

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: Not a lot of time, anyway. So...? You guys in love or what?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I mean, we've been trying to take it slow but...

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: Yep. You're in love. I can tell.

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: And how did you meet, again?

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Remember when I volunteered at the community center?

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: And he really is so good looking, isn't he? You'd have beautiful babies.

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: Uh oh. Get out of here before it's too late!

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Now, all you have to do is just quit smoking.

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: And we were just beginning to like you.

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: You should have Missy take care of that for you.

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: I thought the whole thing was B.S. too. I smoked for 20 years. She puts me under once, now the sight of a cigarette makes me wanna vomit.

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: Of course, I'd give you the service for free. You are family after all.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Wow. I don't... Thank you. Um, I don't know.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: You guys, normal people don't want strangers fiddling around in their heads.

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: If you change your mind... We're just glad you could join us for the big get-together.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: The party tomorrow? I told you.

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: Oh, well we host a shindig once a year for our friends.

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: A tradition. Some of my Dad's old social club. Some old patients. Some just friends...

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: Who answers the door around here?!

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: One more... So, let me set the scene. I'm a junior; Ro's a freshman and she has a crush on this guy Connor--

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: No, no... These are good. I wanna hear this.

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: Manners, Rose. Give the guest what he wants.

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: Connor Garfield was on my lacrosse team. Huge guy, like 6'3", and crazy, just like "Looney Tunes," right? We had thrown a party--

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: I think my parents were in Greece or something. We had gotten into their liquor cabinet and we're all shit-faced.

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: We put water in the bottles so you wouldn't know. Let me finish. Okay, so I'm upstairs in my parents' bathroom hooking up with Jenny Richardson. Hottest girl in our class.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: You realize you're coming off like a total douche right now, right?

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: Thanks. All of a sudden Connor starts banging on the bathroom door, right? I open it, and he's got blood gushing out of his mouth and he's screaming "Your thith-ter bit my fuckin' thongue off!!!!"

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: Sure enough, there is a centimeter of tongue meat missing right here.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: He cornered me and shoved his tongue in my mouth, so yeah.

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: I'm going to see how dessert is coming along.  Maybe we can change the conversation to something a little lighter.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Yeah, great story. Thanks for making it totally uncomfortable.

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: Okay, new subject. Chris, Yanks or Mets?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Ah, Orioles. My mom was from BALTIMORE SO--

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: She's right. Let someone else talk for a bit.

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: You've had your chance. He's dating my sister. I can't bond with the guy?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: You mean like UFC? Yeah, nah. Too brutal for me. I'm a lover, not a fighter.

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: You ever get into street fights as a kid?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Not really. I did take Judo for after-school in 1st grade.

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: Cause, with your frame, your genetic make-up? If you pushed your body, I mean really trained, you'd be a beast.

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: We're talking about sports.  Stand up. Let me show you something.

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: No karate at the dinner table.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I've got a rule. I don't play- fight with drunk dudes.

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: I wasn't going to hurt him.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Yeah. Nerves got me I guess.

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: Come. Let's nip this in the bud.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I still don't know if this is right for me.

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: There really is no need to be nervous.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I'm good. The dude was running out there. Scared me.

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: Walter starts early every day. He's borderline obsessive compulsive. Tea?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Nah, I'm good. It'll keep me up.

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: You watch a lot of Television. Now, you are feeling very sleeepy...

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Heightened suggestibility. Okay, where do we start?

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: Wounds get locked in your heart and they fester and grow into ugly little things like depression and addiction. But, they are all in there somewhere. All we need to do is find the key.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I guess if it makes me quit... Wait... Has it started--?

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: --we're going to go back to a place that might be uncomfortable for you. Your Mother's death to be specific. Were you there when she was hit?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I was home. I was watching TV.

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: Let's go back there. Hear this place. Let the vibrations rush run through your body and ears. Hear it... Find it... Tell me when you find it.

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: Good. How did you find out she died?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I knew it. She was never late after work. When she didn't come home, I just knew something was wrong.

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: Good. Now touch. Feel your surroundings. Feel every part of your body and what you touched. Feel it. Find it... Tell me when you find it...

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: You said `you knew something was wrong.' What did you do?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I just sat there. Watching TV.

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: You didn't call someone? Your Aunt or the police?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I don't know. I thought if I did, it would make it real.

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: Next is smell and taste. Breathe in and let the scent fill your nose. Smell that place. Taste it. Find it.

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: Good. Now lastly, you must see it. Let the light flood into your eyes. Every color, every detail. See it. See it. Find it.

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: You think it was your fault.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: No! NO!!! I'm done! Bring me back! Please!!!!

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: Now you are in the Sunken Place.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: Nothing I don't want to be doing.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: I know who you are. You're Rose's friend.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Yeah. That's one way to put it. So, where you from originally?

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: One of a kind; a real doggone keeper.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Oh, yeah. Actually, I guess I was pretty drunk.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: And the hypnosis? Did it work?

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: Well, I should get back to work.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Out. Taking pictures. Hey, so I think your mom hypnotised me last night.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I think I snuck out for a smoke, and she caught me and offered? I don't know. I must have agreed to it `cause the thing just made me nauseous.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Okay. Well then that's good, right?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: No, not good. I can barely remember any of it even happening; I don't like that. Plus I had these fucked up dreams.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: The nightmares. When I was a kid. She hypnotized me once for stage fright, and I had the craziest nightmares, but it worked...

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: And, what's the deal with the help?

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Like... The iced tea thing? Yeah that was weird.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: That, but also the lawn-mower guy creepin' me the fuck out too.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: It's not what he says, it's how he says it. You know?

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Yeah, something about them seems... different.

Speaker: gordon
Dialogue: Nice to meet you, Chris. Nice to meet you indeed.  Good grip.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Once, actually; a few years ago. I wasn't very good.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Gordon was a professional golfer for years.

Speaker: gordon
Dialogue: Can't quite swing the hips like I used to though. You know, I met Tiger.

Speaker: gordon
Dialogue: Best I've ever seen. Ever, hands down. Let's see your form.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Me? I could barely hit the thing.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: It'd be kind of a waste of time travel though.

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: So, is it true? The love making. Is it better?

Speaker: april
Dialogue: Who even cares about skin color? My God.

Speaker: parker
Dialogue: The world cares, April. But it's not a question of physical superiority, it's "What skin color is more culturally advantageous?"

Speaker: parker
Dialogue: Fairer skin is has been in favor' the last couple of thousands of years, but the pendulum has swung back again hasn't it..?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I'm sorry. I'm going to get another drink.

Speaker: parker
Dialogue: I didn't mean to offend him.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Really? `Cause you have yet to say anything that's not a blanket statement about race.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: It's good to see another brother around here.

Speaker: andre
Dialogue: Why, the Armitage's of course. We're friends of the family.

Speaker: phil
Dialogue: There you are. Here, put this somewhere.

Speaker: phil
Dialogue: Fantastic. Logan and I know Rose very well.

Speaker: andre
Dialogue: I'm sorry, where are my manners. Logan, Logan King.  Chris was just telling me that he felt more comfortable with my being here.

Speaker: phil
Dialogue: That's nice. Logan, I hate to tear you away, dear, but the Wincott's were asking about you.

Speaker: andre/logan
Dialogue: Ah, well it was nice meeting you Chris.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: All of them. Ignorant assholes. They have no idea what real people go through.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I guess people only see what's in front of them.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Heh. No, you're right. And usually not even that much. That's people.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: I know who you are. I'm an admirer of your work; you have a great eye...

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Wait. Jim Hudson... of Hudson Galleries?

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: The irony of being a blind art dealer isn't lost on me.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: I have an assistant describe work to me. You've got something... The images you capture... so brutally melancholic. Powerful stuff.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Thank you. Yeah, I just like finding the beauty in abandoned things.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: I used to dabble myself. Wilderness mostly. I submitted to Nat Geo 14 times before realizing I didn't have "the eye" for it; Began dealing. And then, of course, my vision went to shit.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: I know. Life can be a sick joke. One day you're working in a dark room, and the next day - BAM. You wake up in the dark. Genetic disease.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Yeah, sure.  Nice to meet you.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Stop by the gallery some time. Bout time you had a solo show.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Really? Wow, okay. Thank you. That would be a game changer.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: I think we could do wonderful things together.

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: HA! Come on. You can do better than that!

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Not my game, what can I say.

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: I'm just saying, if your boy isn't gonna bring his `A' game, we might as well bring Mom up here.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Whoa, whoa, okay. Now we talkin' smack huh?

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: See, that's what I'm talking about!!! Okay, again!

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I'm gonna go to the bathroom.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: I'm sure it was an honest mistake.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Yeah, or maybe not. Maybe she doesn't like the fact that I'm with you.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: You think my family's housekeeper gives a shit who you're with? That's crazy bae.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Look, I get it. This whole thing is stressful. I mean, they're circling you like hyenas down there. I just don't get why you're taking it out on George and Walter.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: You're right. I'm being paranoid. I just need a minute and I'll be down.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: Not much. Sid's chillin'. We eatin' burgers. What's up with you?

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: Uh oh. That doesn't sound good.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: They just got me over here meeting all the family friends. It's like they never met a black dude that doesn't work for them or some shit.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: Oh, they got you on display?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Exactly. Also, I got hypnotised last night...

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: Nigga, what the fuck? Oh, Hell no!

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Yeah, to quit smoking. Rose's mom is a hypnotherapist--

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: --Nope. I don't give a fuck if she's Dr. Drew up in this bitch. You ain't getting in my head.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: Who knows what they'll make you do. You know white people into some crazy sex slave shit.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Yeah, I'm like 99% sure they're not a kinky sex family, but-

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: Why not? Jeffery Dahmer ate niggas' heads, but that was after he fucked the heads.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: And thanks for that image, right there.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: I saw that on A&E, so that's real life.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: It's the black people out here that are the weirdest. The help. It's like they're possessed or...

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: I'm just connecting the dots you presenting me with. The mom puttin' trances on niggas and fuckin' them. It's clear as day and that's fucked up. She hot?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: What's fucked up is: You're the first line of defense against terrorism.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Oh, and the one other black guest is like the whitest-most dude at the party.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: Send me a picture. You are a photographer.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: And yo, don't say I didn't warn you `cause my ass sure as Hell ain't coming up to the country to save you from no fuckin' witch coven... Unless the mom's hot. She hot?

Speaker: georgina
Dialogue: I owe you an apology. I shouldn't be touching things that don't belong to me.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Oh, no. It's cool. I was just confused.

Speaker: georgina
Dialogue: I lifted your cellular phone this morning to wipe down the dresser and it accidentally came undone, see?

Speaker: georgina
Dialogue: Rather than meddle with it further, I left it that way.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Really, it's okay. I didn't mean to rat you out.

Speaker: georgina
Dialogue: Oh no, no, no, no, no, no... Aren't you the sweetest thing? Not at all. The Armitages are so good to us; They treat us like family.

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: Chris! There you are. I wanted to introduce you to some old friends. We'll do it quickly. Down the line: David and Marcia Wincott, Ronald and Celia Jeffries, Hiroki Tanaka, and Fredrich and Jessika Walden.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Too many names to remember but...

Speaker: hiroki
Dialogue: Do you find that being African American has more advantages or disadvantages in the modern world?

Speaker: andre/logan
Dialogue: My life as an African American has been, for the most part, very good. It's hard to be too specific as I haven't much desired to leave the house in a while.

Speaker: andre
Dialogue: GET THE FUCK OUT OF HERE!!!!

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: Yes. Logan's okay. Missy's with him now. Are you okay Chris?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Yeah. Why did he come at me like that?

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Yeah seizures don't make people attack people, I'm sorry.

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: It was an abnormal manifestation but yes, actually, sometimes they do. The flash on your phone must have triggered it.

Speaker: andre/logan
Dialogue: Well, I do believe I owe you all an apology.

Speaker: missy
Dialogue: We're just glad you're feeling yourself again.

Speaker: andre/logan
Dialogue: Well yes I am. It's quite like being trapped in a dark room and watching my experiences through a window. Thank God you and Dean were here to calm me down.

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: It's a simple glitch of the brain. Nothing to be afraid of.

Speaker: andre/logan
Dialogue: I know I scared you all quite a bit.. especially you Chris.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: No, I'm sorry about the flash. I didn't know.

Speaker: andre/logan
Dialogue: Of course. How could you have?

Speaker: phil
Dialogue: You shouldn't have been drinking either.

Speaker: andre/logan
Dialogue: As I said I'm feeling much better now, but you'll all have to proceed without the aid of my marvellous wit; the whole thing has left me a quite a bit exhausted.

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: Let's do sparklers shall we? Brighten the mood?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: My cousin is epileptic. That wasn't a seizure.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Honestly? That was one of the strangest things I've ever seen in my life.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Also, this is gonna sound weird, but when he got up in my face like that, I got the feeling like I knew that guy.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I'm just... Something doesn't feel right.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: No. With this whole situation! I just... I can't explain but I need you to trust me. Let's just go. It doesn't even have to be a big deal.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: It is a big deal. It's my family. I wouldn't even know what to tell them.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Yes, it's weird. There are a lot of ways I wish this was going different. I wish my brother wasn't a cock. I wish my parents friends were chill; but just because it's tough, it doesn't mean you run away...

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: I should've got my period like last week.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: I mean, I did change my birth control, so it could just be that, but...

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I don't know what to say.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Okay... Try any emotional response whatsoever.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I told you about the night my mom died. How I didn't call 911; didn't go out looking for her.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: One hour went by, then two, three... I just sat there... I just watched TV.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I found out later she had survived the initial hit.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Yeah... yeah. So, I'm not gonna leave here without you. I`m not going to abandon you. Never.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Fuck it. Come on. Let's go back home.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Yeah. I mean, you're right. This sucks. I'll go back with you. I'll make something up.

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: Bye Chris! It was a pleasure meeting you. I hope you--

Speaker: nelson
Dialogue: Come on, Lisa. Before you say something stupid.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: Andre um... Hayworth! Yeah! He used to kick it with Veronica.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: ...Teresa's sister! Worked at the movie theatre on 8th;

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: This is so fuckin' crazy. He's different now.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Different. Slower... I mean he was street; now he's all like... white- seeming. Oh, plus he's gay!

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I'm telling you: He's gay, I met his man. He's--

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: Chris, you in a fucked up Eyes Wide Shut situation. You need to--.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: I was just looking for them. I'm such a mess, will you help me?

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: Where are you going? The party's just getting started.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I'm going to the car; see if we left the keys in there.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Oh, I know where they are. In my bag. Duh.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: His dog is not well. He needs to go to the vet first thing in the MORN--

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: In life? What is your purpose..?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Right now, it's finding the keys.

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: We've been looking for our purpose for such a long time. Fire has mesmerized man since the Stone Age. It is a reflection of our impermanence in the world. Fire is born, it breathes and then it dies.

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: There's a reason we worship the Sun, Chris. He who lights the way through the darkness of life. He in all his glory was around long before us and will be here long after we are gone, but he too will die some day! That's right even the Sun God will die. It is no less mortal than we, but it inspires us to defy it! So what do we do?--

Speaker: dean
Dialogue: I'm saying that we've found OUR PURPOSE!!! There must be a sacrifice! Sacrifice is essential for the righteous to achieve our true potential. A vessel must be comprised. A host must be born!!!

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Oh baby... You know I can't give you the keys.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Rose!? No, no, no, no. Shit, shit...

Speaker: gary
Dialogue: Hey... two strikes. Go take 10; get it together.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: Sup? Making sure you good. I thought you were coming back yesterday, so hopefully you home already and just sleeping or some shit. Aiight. Let me know.

Speaker: detective latoya
Dialogue: ...Then he should've gone back up there and made sure everything was accounted for.

Speaker: detective latoya
Dialogue: You know that TSA issues should be brought to your authorizing officer, right?

Speaker: detective latoya
Dialogue: Please don't call me "ma'am," or we're not gonna get along. How can I help you, Rod Williams from the TSA?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Here it is: My boy Chris has been missing for two days.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: No, sorry, not my son, my boy. He's my friend. He's 26. His name is Chris... Washington...

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: Yeah, I mean he's only been MISSING for two days. He was SUPPOSED--

Speaker: detective latoya
Dialogue: --I'm gonna stop you right there. Now you know the minimum amount of time without contact before you can file a missing persons report IS--

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: --Three days I know, but I have reason to believe he's been abducted.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: Chris was set to come back home on Sunday. I was watching his dog Sid.

Speaker: detective latoya
Dialogue: Don't look too missing to me.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: Well that's the thing. We found him and now, according to Chris, he's gay with a different personality.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: But he didn't used to be.

Speaker: detective latoya
Dialogue: I think he might just argue with you on that one.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: I know what I'm about to say is gonna sound crazy.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: You ready for this...? I think this family is abducting black people and brainwashing them to work for them as sex slaves and shit... Sorry.

Speaker: detective latoya
Dialogue: Hold on one second.  I want you to tell these officers exactly what you just told me.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: ...See, I don't know if the hypnosis makes you a slave or if just turns you gay or what, but they already got two brothers that we know of, and who knows how many more there could be.

Speaker: latoya
Dialogue: So, I don't want none of you sayin' I don't do nothin' for you... White girls'll get ya every time!

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Is this the only song you got?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Okay. Okay! What do you want? You tryin' to break me? I won't say shit!! I'll just... I'll do what you say, just answer me!

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: He left like two days ago.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: We got in a fight. He got all paranoid and flipped out; He took a cab home. He forgot his phone. Wait... You haven't seen him?

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: No. He never made it back here.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: I've been calling. I went to the police and everything.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: I told them he was missing.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: So... What cab company did he use?

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: I don't know. A local one I'm guessing. Maybe uber? Wait, I'm so confused...

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Come on. I mean, it's kind of obvious.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: We'd all go out drinking... I remember you looking at me.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: That's my best friend. If you did SOMETHING--

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: I know you think about fucking me, Rod.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: ...Winter, Spring, Summer and Fall, all you need to do is call. And I'll be there. You got a friend. Ain't it good to know you've got a friend. Ain't it good to know you've got a friend. Oh, yeah, yeah, you've got a friend.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Hello Chris. How's it going...? You can answer. There's an intercom in the room; I can hear you.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Yeah, sorry about that. If it makes you feel any better, I'm thirsty too.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I need to get outta here.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Right. So, the reason I am talking to you now is so you can understand what is happening to you. I guess your `understanding' it raises the success rate of this whole thing. Not even sure I `understand' it.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Hot isn't she? Hot voice anyway, you dirty dog. You're one of the lucky one's. The son Jeremy's wrangling method sounds way less pleasant.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Is this some kind of a game to you?

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: They asked me for my favorite song, which was hard; I like all types of music. Turns out they really just needed one I knew all the words to: I went with James Taylor's "You Got a Friend." I hope it hasn't been too torturous; that wasn't the point. The point is that you learn it, and for us to have that knowledge in common.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Who the fuck are you people?

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Oh right. Okay, let me back up and give you the cliff notes. The Armitages and I are a part of a society. A pretty extraordinary society actually.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: You hypnotize me? Break my will..? Make me a slave like the others? This is some crazy racist shit.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: No. Not racist, Chris. We don't hate you. We want to be you... You are not going to be a slave. You're going to be a vessel.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Missy's hypnosis was merely to sedate you. Oh, that and to prepare you psychologically...

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Are you ready...? Drum roll please. Brain transplantation. Some say it could never be done;

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Dean's the only guy who really gets the science. He's the one who discovered that full brain transplantation isn't actually necessary to transfer the soul, and that partial brain transplantation solves the little nerve ending problem.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Okay so... You see the blue part? That's the piece of your brain that's all rooted in the nervous system. So that stays; keeping those tricky little connections intact. The rest is discarded. Then they'll remove the red part of my brain from my skull and put in yours. Your "blue" and my "red" basically absorb each other. And apparently the brain heals surprisingly fast, so assuming everything goes as planned, we should be up and functioning in a couple weeks.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Your red part? It'll be discarded, but don't worry. You wont be gone. Well not completely. You'll still be in there somewhere; limited consciousness of course;

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Yes. That's what she calls it. Good! So you understand, I'll control the motor functions, the will of our body, effectively MAKING ME--

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: As far as the world is concerned. It's still a pretty new operation. Some kinks. We're supposed to stay away from flashes of light for example. They can trigger a "momentary lapse in control of motor functions..."

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: Well, because you get the highest bids. For the last decade or so anyway. I wish it was less simple than that, but it's not. You're in fashion, baby!

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: You're not going to get away with this.

Speaker: jim
Dialogue: We have and we will. We'll be together soon, brother.

Dialogue: No... no... Don't do it... Just get the fuck gotta here... Just go! Just... Fuck!
